H0.text: Neurotransmitters are the chemicals released by an axon when a nerve impulse reaches its end.

H1.text: Neurons are the chemicals released by the axon when a nerve impulse reaches its end.

H2.text: Electrolytes are the chemicals released by the axon when a nerve impulse reaches the end of an axon.

H3.text: Receptors are the chemicals released by the axon when a nerve impulse reaches the end of the axon.

A4.text: When an action potential reaches the presynaptic terminal, the action potential can trigger the release of neurotransmitters into the synaptic cleft.

A5.text: Neurotransmitters are released from synaptic vesicles into the synaptic cleft where they are able to interact with neurotransmitter receptors on the target cell.
